{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox Election | election_name = United States gubernatorial elections, 1999 | country = United States | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States gubernatorial elections, 1998 | previous_year = 1998 | next_election = United States gubernatorial elections, 2000 | next_year = 2000 | seats_for_election = Governorships of [[Governor of Kentucky|Kentucky]], [[Governor of Louisiana|Louisiana]] and [[Governor of Mississippi|Mississippi]] | election_date = October 3, 1999 (LA), November 4, 1999 (KY and MS) | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 31 governorships | seats_before1 =31 | seats_after1 = 30 | seat_change1 = -1 | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 17 governorships | seats_before2 =17 | seats_after2 = 18 | seat_change2 = +1 | map_image = 1999 Gubernatorial election map.svg | map_size = 320px | map_caption = '''Results:'''{{Legend|#800|Republican holds}}{{Legend|#008|Democratic holds}}{{Legend|#00f|Democratic pickups}} }} Three gubernatorial elections were held in the U.S. in 1999. [[Kentucky]] and [[Mississippi]] held their general elections on November 4. [[Louisiana]] held the first round of its [[jungle primary]] on October 23 and did not need to hold a runoff. *[[Kentucky gubernatorial election, 1999]] *[[Louisiana gubernatorial election, 1999]] *[[Mississippi gubernatorial election, 1999]] The [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] had a net gain of 1 seat, picking up an open seat in [[Mississippi]]. ==Election results== A bolded state name indicates an article about that state's specific election. {| class="wikitable" !
